widgets
Class MTSlider

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      widgets.AbstractGUIWidget
          widgets.MTSlider
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent, org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent3D, org.mt4j.input.IMTInputEventListener, org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
StdMTSlider
public abstract class MTSlider
extends AbstractGUIWidget

This class represents a slider in the GUI-context. The slider is able to process gestures and lets you adjust some floating-point value.

Version:
20110522
Author:
langenhagen

Constructor Detail

MTSlider

public MTSlider(processing.core.PApplet pApplet)
Main constructor

Parameters:
pApplet - The Application which is rendering this GUI-component as a PApplet
Method Detail

setValue

public abstract boolean setValue(float val)
Sets the value of this slider to the specified value. If the specified value is not within the value-range, no changes will be performed.

Parameters:
val - The new value as a float.
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the specified value is within the value-range, otherwise returns FALSE.

getValue

public abstract float getValue()
Returns the current value

Returns:
The current value as a float

setValueRange

public abstract boolean setValueRange(float min,
                                      float max)
Sets the value-range of this slider to the specified values.

Parameters:
min - The smallest possible value as a float
max - The biggest possible value as a float
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the action was successfull, otherwise returns FALSE (e.g. when the specified min-value is smaller than the max-value)

getMaxValue

public abstract float getMaxValue()
Returns the greatest value the slider can take.

Returns:
The biggest value, the slider can receive, as a float

getMinValue

public abstract float getMinValue()
Returns the smallest value the slider can take.

Returns:
The smallest value, the slider can receive, as a float

setMinValue

public boolean setMinValue(float min)
Sets the smallest value the slider can take. If the specified value is bigger than the biggest possible value, no changes will be performed.

Parameters:
min - The new smallest value as a float
Returns:
Returns FALSE, if the specified value is bigger than the biggest value of the value-range, otherwise returns TRUE

setMaxValue

public boolean setMaxValue(float max)
Sets the biggest value the slider can take. If the specified value is smaller than the smallest possible value, no changes will be performed.

Parameters:
max - The new biggest value as a float
Returns:
Returns FALSE, if the specified value is smaller than the smallest value of the value-range, otherwise returns TRUE

setVertical

public abstract void setVertical(boolean b)
Specifies, if the slider will be horizontally or vertically aligned.

Parameters:
b - TRUE specifies, that the slider will be vertical, FALSE specifies, that the slider will be horizontal

isVertical

public abstract boolean isVertical()
Determines, if the slider is be horizontally or vertically aligned.

Parameters:
b - Returns TRUE, if the slider is vertical, otherwise returns FALSE, if the slider is horizontal
